pullRequest.body:
Forward port https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/pull/19203

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

nodes.body:
Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7207606425/job/19634780524)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7207606425/job/19634779918)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7207606425/job/19634780251)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

```suggestion
instance [Nontrivial V] : Nontrivial (SimpleGraph V) :=
  ⟨⟨⊥, ⊤, fun h ↦ not_subsingleton V ⟨by
    -- porting note: Was `simpa [ext_iff, Function.funext_iff] using h`
    simpa only [SimpleGraph.ext_iff, Function.funext_iff,
      top_adj, bot_adj, ne_eq, eq_iff_iff, false_iff, not_not] using h⟩⟩⟩
```
I assume moving these above `map_monotone` was deliberate?
Yes, to match the `comap` lemmas. I missed that in the Lean 3 PR.
Why did this change?
The generated lemma `comap_Adj` does not follow the naming convention.
Please teach simps to generate the correct name
Actually, the generated `comap_adj` has explicit arguments that should be implicit. So I'm still removing the `simps` even though the generated lemma now has the correct name.
Can you file an issue about `simps` doing that?
I don't like the look of this instance, but that's out of scope for a forward-port PR.
@kmill had the same complaint in #7712 (which has some overlap with this PR). I will continue the discussion there.
Can you fix this in a standalone PR? I think it should just be a case of adding some `simps` configuration to rename the projection

```suggestion
-- TODO: Restate using `SimpleGraph.IndepSet` once we have it
```
or is `IndepSet` a function not a type?
It's currently nothing, but you're right nonetheless.
This doesn't seem to be on the port dashboard, but looks reasonable anyway.
Yes sorry I added that.
This looks like a nicer proof than the new one, and I don't see it in the dashboard diff; was this accidental?
This is because `mem_cliqueFinset_iff` has now moved below to take advantage of the `variable {G}` I added.
I think you should optimize for the proof itself, not minimizing `variable` noise. You might want `variable {G} in`, (or `(G) in`), now that we're in Lean 4.

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion simp [CliqueFreeOn, isNClique_iff, ← subset_singleton_iff', (Nat.succ_ne_zero _).symm] ```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: More clique lemmas
